156.body: Change the world. Build a business. Have fun.
156.author: Evan Williams

157.body: You have to pay attention to money, but it shouldn't be about the money.
157.author: Tim O'Reilly

158.body: Whether you prevail or fail depends more on what you do to yourself than on what the world does to you.
158.author: Jim Collins

159.body: Good ideas need good strategy to realize their potential.
159.author: Reid Hoffman

160.body: The media often glamorizes successful founders and makes their paths seem easier than they actually were.
160.author: Jessica Livingston

161.body: You can't be afraid to fail because that's when you learn.
161.author: Michael Dell

162.body: One clear focus for everyone. Your business needs laser focus on what the next objective is. Execution is key.
162.author: Ben Keighran

163.body: You cannot rest the fate of your business and your personal livelihood on top of another person's platform.
163.author: Spencer Fry

164.body: Every company has a rocky beginning.
164.author: Sam Altman

165.body: Success is defined in units of fun. It's all about being happy.
165.author: Jake Nickell

166.body: Do not let failure dictate your future choices.
166.author: Roger Ehrenberg

167.body: It isn't the consumers' job to know what they want.
167.author: Steve Jobs

168.body: You need a team that's going to care about this thing as much as you do.
168.author: Scott Heiferman

169.body: The best investor is your customer.
169.author: Esther Dyson

170.body: Individuals don't build great companies, teams do.
170.author: Mark Suster

171.body: Every no gets me closer to a yes.
171.author: Mark Cuban

172.body: To have a great idea, have a lot of them.
172.author: Thomas Edison

173.body: Create something simple. Let the market pull you in.
173.author: Brad Burnham

174.body: Tell anyone and everyone your idea without fear they're going to steal it.
174.author: Aaron Patzer

175.body: No is easier to do. Yes is easier to say.
175.author: Jason Fried

176.body: If everything you do works, then you're not taking many risks and probably aren't innovating either.
176.author: Paul Buchheit

177.body: You have to do what you dream of doing even while you're afraid.
177.author: Arianna Huffington

178.body: I try to work the hardest I can without burning myself out.
178.author: Justin Kan

179.body: To build a startup is a marathon. To run fast is good. To adopt the right slow pace is often required.
179.author: Jean-David Chamboredon

180.body: The first rule of doing work that matters: Go to work on a regular basis.
180.author: Seth Godin

181.body: If you need the user to tell you what you're selling, then you don't know what you're selling, and it's probably not going to be a good experience.
181.author: Marissa Mayer

182.body: Startups are based in faith, and the ones that succeed have no fear.
182.author: Micah Baldwin

183.body: Surround yourself with value creators so you can be open with your heart and mind in an environment based on grace, merit and generosity.
183.author: Shervin Pishevar

184.body: We did anything possible just to get revenues so that we could grow and be a real business.
184.author: Mark Pincus

185.body: No one remembers how you got there, only that you got there.
185.author: Jason Calacanis

186.body: Don't let people tell you your ideas won't work.
186.author: Dennis Crowley

187.body: It's very easy to be different, but very difficult to be better.
187.author: Jonathan Ive

188.body: An essential aspect of creativity is not being afraid to fail.
188.author: Edwin Land

189.body: Don't forget to balance optimism with fact and belief with reality.
189.author: Joe Kraus

190.body: If you don't fail at least 90 percent of the time, you're not aiming high enough.
190.author: Alan Kay

191.body: For the most effective pitch, focus 80% on the problem, 20% on the solution.
191.author: Dave McClure

192.body: Serving our end users is at the heart of what we do and remains our number one priority.
192.author: Larry Page

193.body: If you can't invent the future, the next best thing is to fund it.
193.author: John Doerr

194.body: You should always be working hard on user experience. Not just at the beginning.
194.author: Ryan Carson

195.body: You have to be very nimble and very open minded. Your success is going to be very dependent on how your adapt.
195.author: Jeremy Stoppelman

196.body: The worst thing in the world is to be bland.
196.author: Ben Huh

197.body: Do things that won't scale; it will teach you.
197.author: Brian Chesky

198.body: Success cannot come from standstill men. Methods change and men must change with them.
198.author: James Cash Penney

199.body: Just be prepared for a long and often uncertain journey. The good stuff doesn't come easy.
199.author: Tim Westergren

200.body: You can't have a better tomorrow if you are thinking about yesterday all the time.
200.author: Charles F. Kettering

201.body: If you want to unleash more creativity in your company, you need to allow for a little contamination. It is the sand in the oyster that creates the pearl.
201.author: Fred Wilson

202.body: The hardest thing about decision making is not taking things personally.
202.author: Kevin Hale

203.body: The idea of an entrepreneur is really thinking out of the box and taking risks and stepping up to major challenges.
203.author: Steve Case

204.body: Only those who are asleep make no mistakes.
204.author: Ingvar Kamprad

205.body: A public-opinion poll is no substitute for thought.
205.author: Warren Buffet

206.body: Reduce. Do as little as possible to get what you have to get done.
206.author: Joshua Schachter

207.body: When you innovate, you've got to be prepared for people telling you that you are nuts.
207.author: Larry Ellison

208.body: You can never let your data dictate design. If you do, you end up following what people currently do and never innovating.
208.author: Aza Raskin

209.body: We have an easily explainable product, but people only get it by example.
209.author: Billy Chasen

210.body: Use your own experiences and pain points to identify an opportunity. Be arrogant thinking you can do it better than others.
210.author: Chris Hughes

211.body: I don't think an economic slump will hurt good ideas.
211.author: Rob Kalin

212.body: Don't play games that you don't understand, even if you see lots of other people making money from them.
212.author: Tony Hsieh

213.body: You can't learn in school what the world is going to do next year.
213.author: Henry Ford

214.body: When I'm old and dying, I plan to look back on my life and say "wow, that was an adventure," not "wow, I sure felt safe."
214.author: Tom Preston-Werner

215.body: Best startups generally come from somebody needing to scratch an itch.
215.author: Michael Arrington

216.body: "Easy" is a word that's used to describe other people's jobs.
216.author: Jason Fried

217.body: It's not just about being small, it's about doing more with less.
217.author: Greg McAdoo

218.body: If you have an urge to build something that could change the world, don't focus on the money, but the legacy you'll leave behind.
218.author: Alexander Tamas

219.body: If you define yourself by how you differ from the competition, you're probably in trouble.
219.author: Omar Hamoui

220.body: It's a great discipline to have to report to somebody - even if you're the sole owner.
220.author: Tim O'Reilly

221.body: If there are nine rabbits on the ground and you want to catch one, just focus on one.
221.author: Jack Ma

222.body: Competition validates you. It creates a category. It permits the sale to be this or that, not yes or no.
222.author: Seth Godin

223.body: Time's a wasting - don't talk about wanting to do something, just start doing it.
223.author: Garrett Murray

224.body: You have no idea if your idea matters until you share it.
224.author: Michael Lopp

225.body: You have chosen the wrong path if it's not fun. And you are probably not taking enough risk if it's not hard and rocky sometimes.
225.author: Marc Benioff

226.body: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.
226.author: Steve Jobs

227.body: If you just work on stuff that you like and you're passionate about, you don't have to have a master plan with how things will play out.
227.author: Mark Zuckerberg

228.body: Act confident, even when you're not.
228.author: Larry Ellison

229.body: Wonder what your customer really wants? Ask. Don't tell.
229.author: Lisa Stone

230.body: If you have more than three priorities, then you don't have any.
230.author: Jim Collins

231.body: If you're passionate about something and you work hard, then I think you will be successful.
231.author: Pierre Omidyar

232.body: Teaching peers is one of the best ways to develop mastery.
232.author: Jeff Atwood

233.body: As a founder you have to build a team some day, so why not start the day you found the company?
233.author: Ron Conway

234.body: Get a mentor in the applicable field if you're at all unsure of what you're looking for.
234.author: Kyle Bragger

235.body: The more people we have on our team, the less room there is in the elevator and the more complicated everything gets.
235.author: David Karp

236.body: You can do not just twice as much but 200 times as much when you have a good partner.
236.author: Arianna Huffington

237.body: When you find an idea that you just can't stop thinking about, that's probably a good one to pursue.
237.author: Josh James

238.body: I never thought of myself as an entrepreneur before I started this. I just like to build things.
238.author: Andrew Mason

239.body: Everybody's chasing that leading edge, but there's an awful lot of opportunity in the trailing edge.
239.author: Matt Rutledge

240.body: If you want to create something great and do it faster than the competition, you need to be action oriented.
240.author: Fred Wilson

241.body: People do make judgments of trust on appearance - in the real world and online.
241.author: Aaron Patzer

242.body: Find something you love to do. If you don't make money at it, at least you love going to work.
242.author: Mark Cuban

243.body: You can keep your privacy in the world by keeping your product, not your personality, the star.
243.author: Sarah Lacy

244.body: An invention that is quickly accepted will turn out to be a rather trivial alteration of something that has already existed.
244.author: Edwin Land

245.body: Ship early and quietly, talk to early-adopters and improve. Keep doing that in cycles.
245.author: Jon Yongfook Cockle

246.body: Assume the best but hire paranoid people.
246.author: Evan Williams

247.body: No successful company has had ever been the product of just one person.
247.author: Caterina Fake

249.body: The main thing is to keep the main thing, the main thing.
249.author: Jim Barksdale

250.body: Move fast and break things. Unless you are breaking stuff, you are not moving fast enough.
250.author: Mark Zuckerberg

251.body: Don't lose sight of user delight.
251.author: Mark Pincus

252.body: We set out to change the world.
252.author: Angelo Sotira

253.body: I believe that not much happens of any significance when we're in our comfort zone.
253.author: Bob Parsons

254.body: Be persistent, and hang on to your vision. And at the same time, be flexible.
254.author: Reid Hoffman

255.body: The difficulty is not making a decision, it's living with the consequences.
255.author: Micah Baldwin

256.body: I grew up with the thought that I wanted to treat people the way I'd like to be treated, and I think if you do that, it's pretty hard to go wrong.
256.author: Nolan Ryan

257.body: Hiring people is an art, not a science, and resumes can't tell you whether someone will fit into a company's culture.
257.author: Howard Schultz

258.body: If you have never done the job, how do you know what to want?
258.author: Ben Horowitz

260.body: I doubt I'll ever go back to corporate work. Once you see the light, there is no turning back.
260.author: Magnus Jepson

261.body: That which does not kill you makes you stronger.
261.author: Dave McClure

262.body: You can drastically increase your chances for success if you try lots of things and bring the best forward.
262.author: Jonah Peretti

263.body: The greatest teacher I know is the job itself.
263.author: James Cash Penney

264.body: Anything that won't sell, I don't want to invent. Its sale is a proof of utility, and utility is success.
264.author: Thomas Edison

265.body: The entrepreneurs that really make it are the ones that start with an idea but are ready to change it at a moment's notice.
265.author: Jeremy Stoppelman

266.body: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
266.author: Alan Kay

267.body: Don't be shy about believing in your ideas - even if folks around you think you're crazy.
267.author: Tim Westergren

268.body: Create a 4-day work week. The benefits are a happier team, increased efficiency and easier recruiting.
268.author: Ryan Carson

269.body: Great companies don't throw money at problems, they throw ideas at problems.
269.author: Greg McAdoo

270.body: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
270.author: Walt Disney

271.body: Openly share and talk to people about your idea. Use their lack of interest or doubt to fuel your motivation to make it happen.
271.author: Todd Garland

272.body: You shouldn't focus on why you can't do something, which is what most people do. You should focus on why perhaps you can, and be one of the exceptions.
272.author: Steve Case

273.body: If there is such a thing as good leadership, it is to give a good example.
273.author: Ingvar Kamprad

274.body: When people are placed in positions slightly above what they expect, they are apt to excel.
274.author: Richard Branson

275.body: A problem well stated is a problem half solved.
275.author: Charles F. Kettering

276.body: I'm always throwing out ideas, so it's not creativity, it's just volume.
276.author: Ben Huh

277.body: It's very important to us that we use our success to support risk-taking.
277.author: Jen Bekman

278.body: I find it hard to manage somebody's work unless I have an intimate knowledge of how to do it myself.
278.author: Justin Kan

279.body: Do things that allow you to win and that allow someone else to win. It is not a zero-sum game.
279.author: Tom Preston-Werner

280.body: If you aren't getting rejected on a daily basis, your goals aren't ambitious enough.
280.author: Chris Dixon

281.body: When you innovate, you've got to be prepared for people telling you that you are nuts.
281.author: Larry Ellison

282.body: Follow the cream of the crop in your area of online expertise and learn from them. Network with them.
282.author: Mark Forrester

283.body: Make sure that you stay directly involved, even as things get bigger.
283.author: Rob Kalin

284.body: We can't be afraid to be weird.
284.author: Andrew Mason

285.body: Document everything. People are voracious for the products of productive people.
285.author: Kevin Hale

286.body: It's fun to be at the edges, and tough to be squeezed in between.
286.author: Bart Decrem

287.body: Spread the word in a way that was natural and not spammy.
287.author: Ade Olonoh

288.body: Friends don't always make the best of business partners.
288.author: Chris Campbell

289.body: As long as you keep doing the right thing and have the best product, you can beat the bigger company.
289.author: Sam Altman

290.body: An invention has to make sense in the world it finishes in, not in the world it started.
290.author: Tim O'Reilly

291.body: The most essential quality for a good team is trust.
291.author: Dina Kaplan

292.body: The cost of hiring someone bad is so much greater than missing out on someone good.
292.author: Joe Kraus

293.body: Don't let people tell you your ideas are stupid - if you're passionate about something, find a way to build it.
293.author: Dennis Crowley

294.body: The idea of being all things to all people is a thing of the past.
294.author: Michael Dell

295.body: Any time is a good time to start a company.
295.author: Ron Conway

296.body: Average people push great people out of a company.
296.author: Jason Calacanis

297.body: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
297.author: Steve Jobs

298.body: When you don't know what to expect, prepare for the unexpected.
298.author: Pierre Omidyar

299.body: Managers tell you where you are; leaders tell you where you're going.
299.author: Rands

300.body: Things that annoy me end up fueling my ideas.
300.author: Josh James

302.body: Success is very much the intersection of luck and hard work.
302.author: Dustin Moskovitz

304.body: We also get thousands of suggestions. The default answer is always no.
304.author: Jason Fried

305.body: If you're building a product, you can't be afraid of hearing criticism about it.
305.author: Kyle Bragger

306.body: You need to be surrounded by good advisors but you also have to trust your instinct.
306.author: Chris Hughes

307.body: Because the majority of people out there are afraid to be different, it allows people like us to own the ball game.
307.author: Peter Shankman

308.body: Our tell-it-like-it-is approach has won us some fans.
308.author: Matt Rutledge

309.body: Timing, perseverance, and ten years of trying will eventually make you look like an overnight success.
309.author: Biz Stone

310.body: A person who is quietly confident makes the best leader.
310.author: Fred Wilson

311.body: The largest opportunities are found in ideas that go against the grain.
311.author: Omar Hamoui

312.body: Make something someone specific needs, launch fast, let users show you what to change, change it, repeat last two.
312.author: Paul Graham
